summary.p: 5 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 114; Qurʾānic Text: Q 2:138-2:146; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 168 x 96mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.
The fragments Marcel 125, Marcel 128 (NLR) and Arabe 348 (c) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
5 fol. 175/176×254 mm (1.45). Support: thin transparent parchment, smooth, of yellowish color. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: one incomplete quire, fol. 1 is a singleton with a stube, the rest are bifolia.
I: H1F H2F H3F / F4H F5H F S.

Text layout: 96×168 mm (1.7), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I. Diacritics: diagonal dashes, not regularly used and probably referring to a later time that the main text. Vocalization: round dots, golden, red and green.

Verse markers: for individual verses – small rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold and colors; for groups of five verses – small teardrop-shaped medallion (type 5.1.1), in gold and red paint (fol. 5v); for groups of ten verses – medallion in the text line (type 5.С.II? – eight-petaled lobed medallion with inscribed circle with eight protruding beams), in gold and colors, with inscribed verse number (مائة واربعون – fol. 2r).
Stitching: fragments of threads have been preserved in the punctures.
Defects: minor stains; in some places – destruction of parchment by aggressive ink.
Old accession numbers: B. 88 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–5v. Surah 2, verses 132(138)–141(146). Incipit:[نحن له عا]بدون * قل . Explicit ليكتمون ا[لحق وهم] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 125, Marcel 128 (NLR) ; Arabe 348c (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
